III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(i) Use of chemical agents including, but not limited to, pepper
spray, tear gas, and mace.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/20/23, youth was being disruptive in their room. Youth
walked towards staff member to talk and was pushed by staff
member. Two additional staff members came in and put youth into
a manual hold and pushed youth against the wall.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
04/20/2023.
Complainant contacted on 04/20/2023, no additional information
was provided.
I interviewed Director at the facility on 04/21/2023. She reported
there was an incident involving Youth A on 04/20/2023 and it
occurred in the classroom. A copy of the incident report was
provided.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 04/21/2023. Youth A is 15
years old and has been at the facility for 9 months. He admitted
that he was agitated and being disruptive in the classroom on
04/20/2023. He said he threw a cup a water at the staff that
morning and told her, “She is lucky I don’t hit females.” Youth A
said he was trying to leave the classroom and Staff 1 told him he
could not leave and that angered him, so he pushed the staff, and
that is when he was put in a restraint. He admitted that he was
pushing and resisting when staff were trying to restraint him. He
denied staff pushed him against the wall, but said he was the one
resisting and pushing the staff. Youth A denied being injured or
hurt because of being put in the restraint. Youth A did not express
any concerns regarding the staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 04/21/2023. Youth B has
been at the facility for 10 months. Youth B reported he was in the
classroom with Youth A and witnessed Youth A push and cuss at
the staff. Youth B said staff immediately removed all the youths
from the classroom, so he did not witness Youth A being
2

restrained. He denied ever being restrained and has never
witnessed staff pushing or getting physical with any of the youths.
He reported feeling safe and did not express any concerns
regarding the staff.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 04/21/2023. Youth C has
been at the facility for one month and is in the same classroom as
a Youth A. Youth C denied witnessing Youth A being restrained.
Youth C said he has never been restrained. Youth C reported
feeling safe, getting enough to eat, and taking medication daily.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 04/21/2023. Staff 1 has been
working at the facility for 3 months. Staff 1 works 1st shift and
usually works on Pod G. She reported on 04/20/2023 Youth A was
agitated and being disruptive from the morning. At one point she
was attempting to redirect Youth A, and he threw a cup of water at
her and told her she is lucky he does not hit female staff. She said
Youth A made had made a gun out of paper and was pointing at
staff and other residents. He also wrote something in Spanish on
a paper and taped to his shirt. Staff told him that he could not
leave the classroom, but tried to leave and pushed the staff. She
immediately got the other youths out of the classroom and that’s
when Youth A was put in a restraint. She denied witnessing staff
push Youth A against the wall.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility 04/21/2023. Staff 2 is a
supervisor and has been working at the facility for 14 years. Staff
reported he was standing outside the classroom when a call came
in for security. He went to the classroom and found Youth A was
acting aggressive and had pushed one of the female staff. He said
he attempted verbal de-escalation, but Youth A was acting
irrational. He usually can calm Youth A down, but Youth A was
very escalated. Staff 2 said Youth A was put in a two-person
standing restraint. He denied Youth A was pushed but said Youth
A was pushing and kicking them. Staff 2 said Youth A was not
injured and was laughing and making jokes after the restraint.
I interviewed Manager at the facility on 04/21/23. Manager has
been working at the facility for 15 years. He reported on
04/20/2023, Youth A was being disruptive and aggressive towards
staff, so staff called for assistance. He was standing outside the
classroom, so he responded to the call. Youth A was escalated
and charged at staff. He said staff immediately cleared the other
youths out of the classroom and Youth A was put in a two-person
standing restraint. The restraint lasted less than 3 minutes. He
denied Youth A was pushed or hurt during the restraint.
3

Video Footage reviewed:
Video dated 04/20/2023 at 11:10 am. Video has no audio. Youth A
is observed in the classroom sitting at the desk and is playing with
gun made from paper. He points the paper gun at another youth
sitting across from him, he points it at the staff member, then he
puts in the paper gun in his mouth. Youth A is seen writing on a
paper and gets up and tapes the paper to the front of his shirt. At
11:15 Youth A attempts to leave the classroom, staff is seen
saying something to Youth A and that is when he pushes staff.
Staff 2 and Manager walk in and attempt to talk to Youth A, Youth
A charges at staff, and at 11:16 AM Youth A is put in a standing
restraint. Youth A is kicking and pushing at Staff during the
restraint and ends up with his back to the wall. At 11:19 am Youth
A is released and appears to be calm.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 04/20/2023. Youth A pushed staff to
gain entry into the hallway ahead of transport. Staff and
Manager arrived on the scene to verbally de-escalated
Youth A, but Youth A continued to resist and charged at
staff. Youth A was physically managed and placed in a two-
man standing position for 3 minutes until he was able to
regain self-control. Youth A was counseled in the
classroom after the restraint.
• Facility’s Handle with Care Behavior Management Policy.
Analysis Based on the interviews of the staff, youth, and video footage,
Youth A was appropriately restrainded and was not pushed. Youth
A admitted to being disruptive and charged at staff prior to being
restraint.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended that staff avoid and try to move youths away
from the wall when performing a physical restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
